private_information: Disks on my peg top->bottom: A, B, C, D

left_peg.goal: Assist in moving all disks to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: I can receive and hold disks as needed
middle_peg.goal: Assist in moving all disks to the right peg following the Tower of Hanoi rules

private_information: Final stack should be A, B, C, D top to bottom
right_peg.goal: Receive all disks in order so the right peg ends with A, B, C, D top to bottom

orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right
There are 4 disks labeled A B C D where A is the smallest and D is the largest
Only one disk can be moved at a time
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Initial configuration: left peg has top to bottom A B C D, middle peg is empty, right peg is empty
Goal configuration: right peg has top to bottom A B C D and left and middle pegs are empty

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Collect the factual state reports from the peg agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem file that encodes the Tower of Hanoi instance for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the domain models pegs, disks, legal moves, and the constraint that larger disks cannot be placed on smaller disks. Ensure the problem encodes the initial stacking and the goal stacking. Target FastDownwards compatibility.
pddl.prompt: You receive local state reports from three peg agents as {state_left}, {state_middle}, and {state_right}. The environment public information is {environment->public_information}. Your objective is {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the peg reports into a single PDDL domain and problem that solve the instance. Keep any peg-specific actions or names clearly separated if necessary. Provide the final PDDL domain and problem ready for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
